Comment:
We‚Äôve maintained 30-40%+ retention, and even when revenue dipped by almost 50% for 3 months after pausing ads to optimize our supply chain, ops and generally taper costs, we stayed afloat‚Äîthanks to loyal customers. I know so many brands that would shut down if ads were paused for more than a month. In fact, 10% of our revenue comes from retention campaigns, beyond regular orders.

Quality, customer experience, and brand values are key. A strong social media presence may get your foot in the door, but it‚Äôs the experience that keeps customers coming back. Many brands overthink discounts for existing customers while focusing purely on new customer acquisition. However, the LTV of existing customers is far better if basics are sorted, and upto 30% discounts to keep them happy are a small dip in margins (but still profitable) when you're not blindly spending on CAC.

Building a customer base is crucial, but at a certain point, once you have a decent number, focus on quality, customer experience and horizontal expansion‚Äîadding more SKUs to cater to the needs and lifestyle of your existing customers‚Äîbecomes key to survival in the long run. 

Being bootstrapped has helped keep blinders on when it comes to sticking to sustainable growth.
